First, have a look at How to Navigate to grasp all the capabilities of the interactive results.

The total cost of the energy system is €20.39 billion per year, or €89.34/MWh on average. That includes capital expenses (CAPEX), fixed operations & maintenance (FOM) and variable operations & maintenance (VOM) costs.

The total cost for the electricity system is €7.17 billion per year, or €[x]/MWh. The most expensive technologies by annualized cost are:

  Cost (€ billion per year)
Solar PV 1.85
Wind offshore 1.64
CCGTs 1.00
Wind onshore 0.94
Batteries 0.54

The total cost for the hydrogen system is €5.73 billion per year, or €[x]/MWh on average. This is mainly due to H2 imports from the Netherlands at a fixed cost of €75/MWh. Electrolysis plants represent only a cost of €0.03 billion per year.

The total cost for the methane system is €7.79 billion per year, or €[x]/MWh on average. This is mainly due to CH4 imports, at a fixed cost of €40/MWh. The production of biomethane costs €[x] billion per year.

The total cost of the CO2 system is €1.25 billion per year, Or €[x]/tCO2. The most expensive technologies by annualized cost are:

  Cost (€ billion per year)
PCCC of CCGTs 0.95
DAC 0.25
CO2 export 0.04
CO2 Balance
Energy Storage

INTEGRATION: Integrated energy systems around gas and electricity: modeling, optimization, investment and regulatory tools for the energy transition by
ULiège & Fluxys.

Funded by Energy Transition Fund of the Belgian federal government
